FuncDef:
The dcb abs-pfc queue enable command enables antilocking PFC for queues on an interface.
The undo dcb abs-pfc queue enable command disables antilocking PFC for queues on an interface. The dcb abs-pfc queue enable command enables antilocking PFC for queues on an interface. The undo dcb abs-pfc queue enable command disables antilocking PFC for queues on an interface. By default, this function is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6860-SAN and CE8850-SAN.
CLIs: undo dcb abs-pfc queue <first-queue-index> [ <second-queue-index> ] enable [ threshold <threshold-value> ]
ParentView: 100GE interface view,200GE interface view,25GE interface view,400GE interface view,50GE interface view,Interface group view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the index of the first queue for which antilocking PFC is to be enabled.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 5.

Specifies the index of the second queue for which antilocking PFC is to be enabled.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 5.

Specifies the buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 512. The unit is KB and the default value is 0.

ExtraInfo: If lossless services on the live network have a long communication distance, for example, in a long-distance DCI scenario, you can run this command to enable antilocking PFC for interface queues.
